value.description: One of mankind's oldest manufactured objects. The knife has taken many forms, but the concept has always remained the same: A handle for holding and a sharp edge for cutting. Despite its simple design, knives made from advanced materials can compete with larger weapons like longswords.
A short spearhandle attached to a long bladed point, designed to be driven into vital organs with a quick thrust. It deals slightly greater damage than a knife, but is much slower to strike.
A polearm tipped with a sharp point for stabbing opponents. Cannot slash multiple body parts like other sharp weapons, but is very good at piercing armor.
A refined club, engineered for efficient swinging and deadly impacts. Capable of crushing smaller body parts and simultaneously damaging the parts they are attached to.
A short sword of ancient design. It is inferior to a knife in almost every way.
The ancient weapon of kings, the longsword can be used for slashing or stabbing, dealing high damage and potentially cleaving multiple body parts in a single swing.
